definition: just a while before/not so long ago/everyone can remember when..
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)

sentences.english: The counter-revolutionary gang was on the rampage for a time, but before long it was completely overthrown.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗一时的反革命匪帮，曾几何时，遭到了彻底覆灭。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, parents worried about their kids being out late at night getting into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，家长总是担心孩子们夜不归宿惹麻烦。

sentences.english: Long says before, I had not mirrored myself.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，我已不再揽镜自照。

sentences.english: George Bush. Long time ago, he was the most powerful man in the world.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，他也是世界上叱诧风云的人物。

sentences.english: When was the last time you were surrounded by Buicks?
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，你被别克车包围过？

sentences.english: How many times we enjoyed ice-creams in the snow with warm fogs breathing out.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，我们在雪天里呼着热气吃冰淇凌。

sentences.english: Not long ago, we spent our youth on this campus.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，我们在这个校园度过了青春时光。

sentences.english: Whose wings loss of hope had lamed.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，希望的迷失折断了梦想的翅膀。

sentences.english: I dreamed a dream in time gone by, when hope was high and life worth living.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，我流连梦境，心比天高，人生充满希望。

sentences.english: Every man has felt himself to be the equal of a god at certain moments.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，每一个人都曾有过与神平起平坐的感觉。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there is such a crime in China, called "Listening to enemy units."
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，在中国有这样一桩罪，叫做“收听敌台”。

sentences.english: These images suggest that, at one time, water did flow there.
sentences.chinese: 这些图像表明了，曾几何时火星上也有水流。

sentences.english: I cannot remember when I have had this much peace of mind.
sentences.chinese: 我不记得我曾几何时有过如此平静的心境。

sentences.english: Once upon a time we fell in love Fall in love with the wild alone.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时我们爱上了孤单恋上了疯狂。

sentences.english: For many years, chimney sweeps were popular.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，烟囱清扫工很流行。

sentences.english: Only a short while ago, no longer looked Mochizuki. ?
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，不再抬头望月了呢？

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
